I was walking down Stanyan with a friend when she commented, "That looks like a cool coffeeshop." Perplexed at not knowing what shop she was talking about I looked around at the window for the name, then at the blank sign above the window, then finally walked in to ask what the heck this place was called. Turns out I missed the wooden sign they stand up at the edge of the sidewalk, but despite the initial confusion I've been walking or biking over here for a few weeks now and have a few points:

First, their coffee is pretty damn good. I can't say it's the best in the city but definitely the best I've had on this side of Market St (and when you're getting to this level of rating it's really the difference between a 9.9 and a 10). I havn't tried any of their espresso drinks other than a cappuccino, but it was definitely up to expectations.

Coming from an architecture background, the environment inside is admittedly a bit sterile. I personally love the Edison style bulbs and the mix of wood/concrete, but there's an excess of unused open space that isn't even well suited to standing around and talking. I'm regrettably one of the laptop crew that frequents this place, and as many people have noted we're a large portion of the shop.

I think they've got a great location, the right coffee, and with the addition of more seating and some laptop restrictions (I know I'm shooting myself in the foot here) could make it a much more welcoming place for those just looking to chat over their Sunday morning coffee.
author: Robert N.

description: Stopped into here when I was in the neighborhood. Really good coffee--one of the best cappuccinos I have had in a while. They do the cappuccino american-style (ie it's basically a latte). Five stars for the coffee alone. They also have iced coffee on nitro, and a variety of fancy-looking equipment. Also really solid homemade bread pudding. The vibe is pretty consistent with other coffee shops in SF, as are the prices. No complaints!
author: Aaron L.

description: Place is nice, spacious, and modern. They also have decent amount of plugs, so it's a great place to get work done on your laptop (and it seems that's what everyone is doing there). My main reason for the 3 star is that they only serve Earl grey tea :-(  I don't know any other cafe with such a limited tea selection.
author: Nancy Z.

description:
Flywheel is probably the best place in the Upper Haight for coffee aficionados, and was my favorite place for the "get work done in a coffee shop" experience. The drip coffee, while a bit slow to receive, yields great results. Seating is hard to come by,  mostly because it's such a great place to get work done.

While I often patronized Cantata when I needed a quick coffee, Flywheel was my favorite place to go when I needed to stick around.
author: Pablo M.

description:
Cappuccinos =Great 
Iced blended drinks= Great 
Study spot = Limited seating, but I work well here
Staff=Friendly 

Small place but very likable. I go here often.
author: Kat M.

description:
It's about time that Upper Haight got a decent coffee shop. It's VERY similar to Sight Glass and Four Barrel, etc. Meaning the space is really beautiful, and there's (or there will be) coffee roasting on site. It's a bit pricey, but it's good coffee, a nice space, and desperately needed in the area.

It looks like they just got up and running, I'd wait a few weeks before they get everything sorted, they seemed a bit frazzled when I passed through last week.
author: Anna H.

description: Delicious and amazing quality coffee. I was visiting from out of town w/friends and we all LOVED it. I fell in love with the area and the coffee was the cherry on top.
author: Maryann S.

description:
Very chill atmosphere, and great coffee. The prices are awesome, and the coffee is also not bad, but I feel like it's missing something... I can't quite put my finger on it. I'll put my money on them being stellar, 5-star worthy when they start roasting their own beans in the back.

I would go back, and recommend to anyone who needs a coffee fix in the Haight area.
author: Will J.

description:
Great coffee, vibe, decor, location, pricing, and wi-fi. 

If a star is awarded per requirement, looks like I went over.

As a bonus, the owner is a down-to-earth Guatemalan that knows the growers that he gets his beans from. 

My favorite cafe in the city :^)

They're not square if you bring a snack from Whole Foods next door, either.

fine print: I'm duplicating all my reviews on foursquare and google which do not practice extortion practices like Yelp does.
author: Valentin B.

description: BTW:  That stench comes from under that green canvas tent in Whole Foods parking lot.
author: Susan L.

description: I love the atmosphere and location of this coffee shop.I have tried their iced coffee and lattes, both are great blends.
author: Marisa L.

description:
Ok, it's not review for coffee. About coffee itself they serve there, this place is for sure one of those which serve the greatest coffee in this neighborhood. HOWEVER, very sad to tell, customer service is awful when you get some of their rude ones(not all of them are like that by the way!) to take your orders.
Today I walked into, ordered a glass of iced latte and one of pastries. Since they placed names for some of their food but not for all of them in their glass case, I tried to pointed it out, that rude lady showed her frustration clearly and said angrily "I don't know which one if you don't tell me the name!" Bitch, then place all names in your glass case for your all food! I again said to her, "it's the one which is the nearest to you, one of pastries".
I didn't fight with her or complained to her anything about her attitude, and just paid for what I ordered. But next time when I go in, if I see her working there to take orders, I'm gonna just walk out and go to one of other cafes near by.
She didn't have name tag on her, but she has short dark blond-ish hair, she was wearing blue pierces which matching the color with her necklace, bit fat.

You better fire those rude people or train them what the good customer service is. So sad since your coffee is awesome.
author: Micky F.

description: Bought a pound of whole beans here .Very disappointing .Didn't  seem that fresh and not roasted enough. As a former roaster and café owner I know little bit about coffee. This is the worst coffee I've ever gotten from a small roaster !! They need to get someone in there that knows how to roast coffee beans. This obviously has to affect the quality of the drinks as well. Would never go back again.
author: Greg B.

description:
I think maybe because the business is new it needs just some time to improve on a few things. But, mostly importantly, the coffee needs to be better than this. And, please get some good baked goods. I mean, really good ones. Cookies that are quality and just not the same run of the mill items. I'm tired of the same coffee shop fair. :-(
Hope Flywheel can do it. It's a lovely place - comfortable and clean. Let's up the coffee and the baked goods, please?
author: Mary M.

description: Except for the decoration and the cafe theme, absolutely noyhing special. Rude cashier! Definitely not recommended ...
author: Reza N.

description: Location is good because you get to look out right across the park. But otherwise nothing special about this place. The coffee is . Major improvement needed.
author: DeesQue N.

description: Beautiful interior, reminds me of Sightglass. Espresso is decent, and the staff are friendly. The wifi works well, and there are plenty of outlets, so this is a great place to get work done. Or, relax, sip your coffee and have fun watching the hippies in the park.
author: Dean R.

description:
It's great that they have so many different Kenyan beans here. Kenyans are my favorite type of bean because of the fruity flavors and complexity that they have and Flywheel gets that. They get that good coffee isn't just about that burnt taste and they do ligther roasts for their Kenyans.
They told me that one is so acidic that if you put milk in it it curdles. I mean you honestly shouldn't be putting milk in their coffee anyway because it's really good and you're just messing up a good thing so that works for me.
author: Linda T.

description: For a peaceful vibe, killer coffee, kind staff and overall super place to call your office away from home, this is it. What more need be said? They have what I am looking for and then some. It always feels good to be here and thus I get more work done faster than elsewhere. Oh, and I can jump higher, run faster and love longer when I leave here. It's THAT good! Hope to see you there (and do come say hello if you see me smiling wide as I work)!
author: Jonathan M.

description: This is the best coffee shop near GGP and the Haight! The staff is always friendly. I like the concrete industrial style of the tables.  Music is always electric and good. I always have to turn on Shazam because I always hear new tunes I like. The soy lattes are consistantly good. A great. place for book club discussions with a warm beverage
author: Jack R.

description: My new local coffee spot. Flywheel is on par with Four Barrel, Blue Bottle and Ritual. Plus, 16 oz. of beans at $14 is a bargain for premium coffee.
author: Nels A.

description:
12.09.04

Very spacious place with an industrial look.
The back is still work in progress.

They need more furniture to accomadate bigger crowd.

The coffee was strong and robust.

Need to revisit to complete review. 
Dropped in when they sold most of the food.

More to come
author: S.K. Y.

description: I am a huge huge coffee snob and conesour and I absolutely loved flywheel coffee ! My favorite is light roast and their Ethiopia amaro gayo is amazing! Not to mention everything is hand crafted! They literally roast their coffee right there in the shop. They also have a  filtering ice coffee systems that takes over 8 hours to filter so that u don't burn off any of the coffee oils and truly get amazing/fresh coffee! When I came in the owners educated me all about the different kinds of flavors I would like almost like a wine tasting ! I loved the industrial/tendy ambiance that offered plenty of power outlets for laptops and a great study/work environment. They also have a back patio area too and are very family/child friendly. I am hooked and will be getting all my coffee from flywheel from now on.
author: Elena M.

description: Great latte! And very nice industry interior design. But there bakery foods are not that good, I order a coconut macaroon. It is really sticky...... And too sweet.
author: Xinyu F.

description: Love the coffee and the ambience of this place. Chill music and great for working.
author: Rudi B.

description:
Coffee made with love! 
A very cozy neighborhood place. Service is amazing, great people.also the have a very  creative and professional approach with coffee.
author: Irin K.

description:
I'm becoming a bigger and bigger coffee snob with age. I've tried more cafes and roasters than the average Joe (yes, trite pun intended) I'd say, especially here in the Bay Area where the coffee is great.

Flywheel gets my vote for one of the most underrated coffee joints in the Bay Area. It's definitely a toss up between these guys and Catahoula in Richmond. The coffee is top notch.

The coffees I've had here are generally on the brighter side, with lots of complexity. Their iced coffee is hands down the best I've had anywhere (better than Blue Bottle). They have some incredible slow drip brewers on display, everything is very appealing visually. 

It's like a giant lab and museum for coffee.

The work spaces are also great...not to be described as comfy, but it will keep you on task.

The ambiance is very similar to that of Four Barrel, but there IS wifi. This isn't a coffee shop that is really geared towards socializing, but it does have a nice (albeit small) back patio for shmoozing. 

I've never had any issues with the staff. They are always friendly, no bullshit. They know what they're doing, and don't seem pretentious about doing it. *Cough* Four Barrel *cough*

Other drinks I've had here: espresso (good) and drip coffee (great). I may try Siphon one day if I can justify spending $5 on a cup of coffee (Hey, I'm already paying $4).

Oh, many people don't know that the bathroom has a key hanging to the left of the door, so if you have to use the bathroom, keep this in mind!

Go-to status: chickity-check
author: Ben W.

description: Such a cute place! I love the trendy vibes from the design and layout of the place! The coffee is also awesome and their cappuccinos are on point!
author: Page F.

description: The coffee is amazing and I am really impressed with the chocolate crumb cake! Overall the product is good... Atmosphere is a little too hipster for me and the baristas came across a little snooty when I had a question. Not enough to deter me from coming back if I'm close but not enough to being me here next time I'm in San Francisco.
author: Kelly M.

description:
Followup: Two weeks later, when the Sysco delivery truck was again parked on Page, with engine running for fifteen minutes beneath apartment windows, I called the manager. He told me it was there because I had written the review of March 20. He added that I'm "one of those people who takes advantage of rent control."

At least we know what Flywheel thinks about two out of three San Franciscans.

I'm just blown away, though, by the utter nastiness of this manager towards a neighbor. Truly antisocial.
author: Carl R.

description:
I dig the aesthetic most about this place--the industrial look is comforting and works well here. 

The house blend coffee is smooth with just enough bitterness from the espresso beans not to be blah. I'm also okay with paying the $2/cup for this. Soy and espresso in the cappuccino was about half and half--the perfect ratio/not just like you're drinking a glass of milk. The fudge brownie was moist and decent, and the chocolate-dipped macaroon was more moist than dry and super-coconutty=satisfied. The only down side was learning that the macaroon came pre-packaged (saw one of the employees open a vacuum-sealed bag of them once).

Only gripes: slow wi-fi, in need of more outlets and tables. There is an outdoor/covered patio being constructed out back, which I learned over my many successive visits.

Can't go wrong with a cup from here.
author: Justin M.

description: I dislike it when certain pretentious coffee shops in SF don't offer wifi -- it makes me want to move back to Seattle.  Part of the reason I purchase overpriced coffee at coffee shops is so I can hang, you know?  Flywheel Coffee Roasters, fortunately, offers wifi and good coffee.  Only wish they didn't close at 7p.
author: Tina H.

description:
The place is new. The coffee is alright. The service is alright. The decor is alright. It all just seems a little unfinished. 

I'm really hopeful than in a few months this place will come together and I can give it a higher review but for right now, it's just alright.
author: Eduardo R.

description: We popped in after a walk through GGP on a typical somewhat chilly SF day. We all had hot chocolate, which was really delicious, and at $2, not a bad deal in this pricey coffee town! Looking forward to having a latte on my next visit.
author: Lesly S.

description: Absolutely amazing atmosphere! This place is a great place to come study/work. There is so much for the eyes to look at. The employees are nice and their foam art is pretty good. My only complaint is their choice of espresso is a little to light for me. But this won't keep me from coming back! Thanks!
author: Danielle W.

description: After a week of having coffee each day different places in SF - this one is probably the best. Awesome espresso comes with a complimentary soda (as it should :-) )
author: Gal M.

description: Almond milk lattes. So glad they have em and can make them well! Their coffee is on par with 4 barrel for sure. Not always too into the music they play, but at least it's not terribly loud. The atmosphere is good and I like the design of the place. Great spot to chill.
author: Tim R.

description: Really nice spot to sit and have a cappuccino for here. The coffee was good, I'm not a fan of the neighborhood, but it's nice that when I have occasion to be in the area I can grab a good cup of coffee.
author: Ali D.

description: Excellent coffee.  My americano was very good. Large interior space with good amount of seating.  I'll return.  Quiet inside too, which was nice.  It has a back patio too.  They have a cool roaster in the back.  Cool place!!
author: Carl H.

description: Wow. Easily the best pour over I've had I this city yet. Kenyan beans. He requested that he heat the cream so as not to let it curdle. Only $3! Good view of homeless kids in GGP being hassled by the cops. Love.
author: Danielle M.

description: I love this coffee shop, lots of open space, seating indoors/outdoors, WiFi, and outlets for those who need it. One of my favorite coffee spots in the city!
author: Vincent S.

description: Great coffee, AMAZING snack selection. But hey! Jerk employee. Next time knock before you walk up and stick a key in the bathroom door and try to open it while someone's taking a pee. Courtesy, thanks.
author: Amanda W.

description: I have nothing against this place, but equally, there is nothing unique about Flywheel. Expensive, albeit decent enough coffee in an awkward warehouse that lends itself to great discomfort while trying to get anything done (get new chairs, or a couch or something). It is so empty inside (they could do so much more with this space) that voices and noise reverberate throughout making it difficult to focus on anything. The large windows up front are rendered useless when the sun is bearing down on you with blinding capacity. I do not intend to visit this establishment again. Perhaps they just need time to settle in here?  The space is really, really awkward.
author: Noah D.

description:
Love this place!
Best Coffee, they also offer almond and soy milk.
Great pastries, very clean, love there layout, and warm inviting place, would definitely recommend Flywheel.
author: Olga F.

description:
Coffee chemists at work. Now, as a non coffee drinker, it gets a little awkward trying to order here ("Do you guys serve anything besides coffee?" "What, you mean like tea? We have tea."), but the banana pound cake is awesome, and the space is perfect if you're looking for a mid-day work spot. Far less anxiety inducing then attempting to go work at one of the well trafficked mission cafes. The baristas seem to select pretty decent music as well. And, if you need a study break, walking around the haight always provides some nice distraction. 

Cons - if you don't drink coffee, prepare to feel ultra uncool. Selection for food/drink outside of coffee is quite limited.
author: Jody D.

description:
Had to kill a bunch of time waiting for my friends at Zazie, so thank you Yelp for telling me to come here.  It has a Four Barrel feel, but is significantly less crowded. I love it. I walked in Sunday morning at around 1130, no line.  Probably because of how ridiculously early that is. I'm actually not being sarcastic this time.  It was daylight savings the night before! And it was the one rare exception to the archaic CA barsmuststopservingat2AM rule.  Obviously had to be awake to break that law.

I digress.  Sat there for maybe an hour, and thoroughly enjoyed my cup of coffee and it's strength.  Needless to say, if I'm ever in Cole Valley again, I'll gladly make the trek over here.
author: Victoria L.

description: In house coffee roast, latte's are pretty spot on. This is a great spot if you find yourself near the panhandle or on your way to GG park on a sunny day and need a "pick me up." Would stick to the brew here, didn't see very many snacks for sale. Whole foods is right next door though if your hurting for a bite to eat. Very lap top friendly, almost always packed with people grinding out work, can be hard to find a spot to sit down at times though. Nice spot with a rustic woody interior.
author: Riley C.

description: Wow, things have really changed since they first opened. Drink quality has skyrocketed, customer service is top-notch and the space is coming along with the opening of the back patio and better lighting. The back area by the roaster is still kind of a "work in progress," but overall, Flywheel is a fantastic spot!
author: Quinn S.

description: Not a bad place to study - relatively quiet with non obtrusive early 2000s indie rock in the background. I find the drinks just okay (why is it that fancy coffee in San Francisco just seems to be code for bitter?). The food is overpriced for what it is but it'll work if you're feeling snacky. But what I find less appealing is the uninterested attitude from the staff I've gotten on a couple of occasions.
author: Teresa T.

description: Coffee was good, but the place appeared to have a very simple menu, which isn't necessarily a bad thing!
author: Shomik C.

description:
I've only tried the Yrgacheffe pour-over here, but that's only because it was the first thing I tried, and it was so delicious that whenever I've been back I can't bring myself to try anything else. Bought a bag of beans and now I get to drink it every day.

If you are a coffee snob, which, I confess, I am, then do yourself a favor and check this place out, and try the Yrgacheffe. I guess try the other things too, if you're into that sort of thing.
author: Eliya S.

description: Very excellent spot - love the great coffees, friendly + helpful staff and interior, but it's often very cold inside on chilly SF days and the music in rotation is really bad... it's also great that this place is geek/nerd central - a ton of developers and designers are always working here with the free wi-fi - just get some better music and it'll be 5 stars :)
author: Kevin K.

description: I am starting with 2 stars - but this is off of one visit - I will be giving them another shot.   I want to like a coffee roaster in my neighborhood.  Though here are the issues I had:  there were only 2 people in front of me and it took 15 minutes for me to get a coffee.  I understand that pour over coffee takes time - but they do not have a system down yet to take multiple orders.  Also, the light roast was sour.  I will update this review when I go another time.
author: Tia B.

description: In a sea of class coffee houses Flywheel stands out. The service is friendly and the coffee is EXCELLENT. The environment is the perfect balance of simplicity and comfort. I have WFH'ed here a few times. WIFI is good and the staff are happy to have you around.
author: Hidegrl A.

description:
Finally! Something better than a noisy four barrell or over-priced sightglass. 

Wifi and plugs. I'm sold.
author: David L.

description: The best coffee in San Francisco, far better than blue bottle. Staff are great and cakes much better than Tartine.
author: Fraser L.

description: Flywheel Coffee Roasters is my "go to" place for a coffee or latte. Each cup of coffee is freshly brewed for each customer. Among my favorite beverages are an iced white mocha, hot mocha, and the blackberry coffee. The interior and equipment are very modern and the cafe is a popular place for getting work done on the computer.  I give flywheel my highest recommendation.
author: Amber B.

description:
I've walked by this place several times and have always wanted to stop in to check it out.  It has such a cool exterior and wide eyed customers looking out from their glass window seats.  There isn't a sign on the door, only a wooden one, standing on the sidewalk welcoming you in.  Which if you don't read, could make you miss this place.  I used to think it was some random start-up company that was way too skool for cool. Every time I walked by I always peered in dreaming of the day I can step inside.  I wanted to be with the cool kids.  Well, that day came.  I was in need of a good go to coffee shop to do some work and was accessible by foot.  It took me some time to think about and then I remembered, there's that cool no-name place a few blocks away.  As I entered and looked around for a table I found one close to an outlet.  I ordered my red-eye and I was given a choice of what coffee beans I wanted.  I chose the Costa Rican one.  I sat down, set up my station, ate my blueberry scone and retrieved my coffee.  "Delicious".  I'm satisfied.  The things I like about this place:

Friendly staff
Great place to study or work
Unique layout
Big open windows
Plenty of outlets 
Steel and wood design - my favorite thing about this place
Comfortable enough to spend hours there
Good coffee and pastries - this should be at the top

I'm going back.  I think I've found my go-to place.  Finally, I don't have to drive around in circles looking for a parking spot anymore.  Yay!  Thumbs up.
author: Marita S.

description: I am not a coffee connoisseur but I really like this place. I have tried others shops in the hood and this has become my favorite. The staff is friendly, the drinks are delicious and reasonably priced. I love that they have stevia and cinnamon.
author: Erinn D.

description: Serious coffee people who will be roasting their own beans soon.  Minimalist Scandinavian decor and exposed beams reminds me of Minneapolis.  Staff is friendly and helpful.  Amazing chai and matcha drink.  Their tea selection is fantastic.  Plus speedy wifi and many different cool seating options. I couldn't have asked for a better coffee house in SF.
author: Eric J.

description: Great little coffee shop.  The atmosphere is industrial with some pretty art on the walls. This can be a great place to work with wi-fi available and Whole Foods right next door.
author: Christy L.

description:
Best. Coffee. In. SF.  No question in my mind about this.

Wonderful atmosphere, kind, professional staff.  Strong coffee that is at the same time smooth and luxurious - not bitter - and it's the perfect way to start your day.  It's that kind of coffee that just makes you feel good at the first sip - rich, flavorful, rejuvenating.  A much different experience than most coffee in the city.  

The coffee at Flywheel is about 100 times better than the coffee at the Whole Foods next door - sorry, I love that Whole Foods but the coffee at Flywheel is on an entirely different level.  Flywheel is just better.  I think they have access to better beans and their owner has a ton of experience in the coffee industry.  It also opens earlier than Whole Foods.

If you're at Whole Foods buying something and you feel like you need a pick-me-up, walk next door for the coffee at Flywheel.  You won't regret it.  They also have great baked goods, try the pumpkin bread and the homemade bread pudding. Plus it's right next to GG park, a great place to hang out, meet with friends, or just quietly enjoy the neighborhood.  This is the next hot coffee spot in SF and it's already attracting a crowd of dedicated customers and fans.

Highly recommend.  Check it out!
author: Matt S.

description: Great coffee in the Upper Haight. Very Sightglass-ish with all the concrete, exposed wood beams, and edison lightbulbs but without the pretentiousness. $2 for a drip coffee is very reasonable as well. Will definitely be coming back.
author: Spencer S.

description: I love this place, I'm so happy they opened up here. the upper haight needed a non-sticky-less-hippie-coffee option. they brew the most delicious iced coffee, everyone is real friendly and the snacks are tasty. free wifi and a good number of electrical outlets are nice too.
author: Coral C.

description: Good espresso drinks and cold brew in a great space with high ceilings and big windows looking out on Golden Gate park. I'd give it 5 stars if the wifi wasn't practically unusable (slow, intermittent connectivity, often takes several minutes to login, 2 hour limit).
author: Steve D.

description: As good as Four Barrel and maybe Intelligentsia. For beans, I like Temple coffee better in California.
author: Alex W.

description: I had a pretty good latte there and the space is nice.  I hope they can keep it up when they start to roast their own beans.
author: Adrian L.

description: The decor is a little cold and factory-ish, but the espresso is fantastic. Will drink again.
author: Fawn F.

description: I love this place.  The decoration is awesome.  It's a drip style coffee shop.  It's right across from Golden gate park, and one of the best coffee shops in the general area, IMO.
author: Samir F.

description:
I heart this place since day 1!
The coffee is seriously so good & I consider myself a somewhat coffee snob.
Beyond the drink the people here are soooo awesome! I love that they know my name, its like Cheers cafe version.

If you have not yet been here, get your butt in!
On a nice day the little backyard spot is the best of both worlds, coffee & sun (and internet :)!

Enjoy!
author: Ashley R.

description: I usually drop by Flywheel in the morning when we're taking the dog on a walk to Golden Gate Park. The drip coffee is really good and there's a small pastry case with chocolate croissants and scones (among other things).
author: Chapman S.

description: A little on the expensive side, but the drinks are good. Super hip place. I come here on the weekends to study. Just expect to pay $4 at least. I also appreciate the cute designs on the lattes.
author: Lauren G.

description: Decent iced coffee but I haven't found it to be on par with the SF usuals (Blue Bottle, Ritual, Sightglass). The space is big but feels like it could use more seating. They are close, but not quite there.
author: Cori W.

description: Amazing coffee! I visited this place on recent my trip to San Francisco and loved it. First time drinking siphon coffee and it was great. Once I came back home, I found out that they sell their coffee online and have even managed to regularly order the Ethopia Amaro Gayo coffee beans. Here is a link in case anyone else is interested http://tinyurl.com/flywheelcoffee. This is a great gem in San Francisco.
author: Vicky K.

description: I really love this place! The decor is beautiful, the coffee is delicious, and it's close to home. Amazing cappuccinos!
author: Chloe A.

description: Just stopped by; didn't expect much. Had a decaf coffee and much to my surprise it tasted like the real thing!
author: Dianne N.

description:
I really enjoy this cafe. I've been looking for a good place near upper Haight, and this has become my regular go to. The coffee is good. The hot chocolate is exquisite. It has a nice ambiance, and I find it easy to focus and get work done here. 

There is a $3 minimum for internet, so if you are buying a chai or a snack, you have to get something else. 

The staff is a little unfriendly though if you are are female and under 35. Not a smile or hello, even if you tip them!
author: Hannah J.

description: what amazing coffee! Pure over coffee strong yet smooth. The best latte`s never and russin tea cakes.
author: maria b.

description: Have discovered my new favorite coffee spot.  Ample seating, outlets, and lighting.  Plus their matcha latte is kinda awesome.
author: Jac J.

description: Almost too good to be true: FINALLY an awesome coffee place in the Haight!!!!!!!
author: Susanne L.

description:
new coffee shop in my hood... and as far as the haight goes, this is as good as it gets in my opinion! 
great coffee, yummy pastries, nice service, free wifi, and clean interior ( yet a bit sterile). 
the matcha latte is excellent, reminded me of japan....
author: Nicole L.

description: Loving their coffee, that's why they are receiving a five. The place seems a bit unfinished, but hoping since they are new they will work out the rest soon, but regardless it has a great cup of coffee.
author: Sarah W.

description: One star simply for the rude service from the muscle man barista. I was on a walk w the bf and dog through ggp. We almost stopped at another coffee shop but I insisted we try this one. I was seriously humiliated standing in this coffee shop after how rude this barista was to me. I ordered 2 Americanas. 1 came out and I asked if it was mine as it was very busy and I didn't want to take someone else's drink. Guess that was a rude question because I was snapped at. The whole group of people waiting for coffees looked embarrassed as well. Not cool. Too many friendly neighborhood places for this rudeness.
author: Amber M.

description: Flywheel is one of the best coffee shops I've ever been to. It's a nice, large, and spacious place. It's a great place to have a cup of coffee and get some work done. The people that work here are also very kind.
author: Yuan T.

description:
Not bad, and much needed for upper haight. seats are readily available and usually it's quiet enough to read for 30-45mins before moving on for the day. Coffee is not at blue bottle or philz level, but fresh and drinkable. Could have more than 1 size "to-stay" sizes though.
Due to it's location, occasional homeless men will come in and sit for a while with all their gear and require the door to be open...
author: eDub W.

description: First and perhaps most importantly, the pour over coffee I had was quite excellent. Unfortunately it took about 15 minutes to be ready, and the place was not busy at 845am on Saturday. The barista was super friendly. The faux industrial chic decor is pretentious in the extreme and exudes all the charm of an abandoned factory, not that anyone here has ever been in a factory, let alone worked in one. The clientele with their expensive computers and high-end baby strollers seem content to ignore their children and surf the web or stare at their phones while sipping $3 cups of coffee, oblivious to the homeless people huddled in the park 30 feet away across Stanyan. Disturbing.
author: Flavio R.

description: I'm no coffee snob, but I do like to try out a new coffee shop now and then to mix things up and enjoy some different working environs. Also, a certain nearby grocery store had not yet opened (grmph), so I needed a place to defrost after a GGP workout and get some breakfast. Despite its hipster vibe, the two folks behind the counter were perfectly friendly, which almost made up for the $4 price tag for a small mocha and $3 price tag for a gluten- and soy-free muffin. Almost. I hadn't had a mocha in several years, and it turns out I no longer like chocolate in my milky espresso. BUT, I deigned to scraped the chocolate sludge off the bottom of the cup for review purposes, and I can report that it was mighty tasty indeed. (You're welcome.) The muffin, though gluten- and soy-free, was decidedly not sugar-free. Goodness, that was one SWEET muffin. Even for my sweet tooth. It was also very cold, which is no good for a baked treat. Alas. However, at the 7ish AM hour, the place was pretty quiet, and the seating and space was comfy and cozy. Plus, there seemed to be enough outlets, so should I want to join the ranks of people "working" on their Macs, I'll be happy to return. Next time, I'm just getting a coffee, though.
author: Jessica K.

description: The cold brew coffee here is extremely good !! Highly recommended
author: Scoot S.

description: Get caffeinated in an industrial style place with hand dripped coffee. Good place to sit and do work.
author: around town e.

description: The decor says hipster third-wave coffee shop/roaster, but the beans taste burnt and the baristas aren't up to the task. Very disappointing; we could use some decent coffee in the Haight.
author: Michael S.

description: Popped in here on a Friday afternoon and I am SO glad I did. The staff was super friendly and their macchiato was better than what I expected. I had some work to get done and this space was perfect. It was very clean and I didn't have to worry about placing my books on someone's leftover sticky spilled coffee. All in all, a great place to study or just sit and enjoy one of their excellent drinks. Definitely a repeat!
author: Megan S.

description:
-when the owner is here, i love this place, he's charming, knowledgeable, explains coffee& has me sold on it.

however,
i went today when a snotty barrista was doing the job. it reminded me of that jack nicholson movie w/ that scene about the chicken salad sandwich.

i asked for a cafe au lait. 
no we dont' do that.
are you out of milk?
no.
so why don't you just steam some milk & put some in a coffee?i'll pay extra.
no.
why?
b/c we don't do au lait.
but i've had it here before (many times the owner has made it for me).
no, we dont do that. idon't even know how to ring it up. 
so i left.

i guess there are enough people willing to fork over $4 for a cup that they don't feel the need to accommodate crazy hot milk requests.

there are so many places in sf to get excellent coffee.
who wants to go through that.
author: Kim Y.

description: 5 stars for 1. shots of espresso on ice (best in SF) and 2. iced coffee. Bonus points for having stevia, biodegradable cups, an awesome space, sweet people but the COFFEE??? Some of the BEST in San Francisco.
author: J Z.

description: The cafe has a really cool industrial look.  The coffee is great and the prices are good for the quality of coffee that they are serving.  I think the place will really be fantastic when the roaster arrives which from what i can understand it should be arriving this week. They also have free wifi which is always a bonus. In terms of pastries they offer daily pastries, crumbcakes and assorted goods. So far i've tried the banana bread and a chocolate dipped macaroon, both of which were moist and delicious.  All in all a welcome addition to the neighborhood which is severely lacking any other decent coffee (and gets 10 stars compared to the coffee at whole foods next door)
author: Hannah S.

description: Lovely place - very trendy and friendly. I love the big open space. Drinks are amazing too!
author: alex e.

description: Great spot and great location. This cafe is local, has a nice vibe, serves great coffee, and has a nice view of the golden gate park.
author: Kine N.

description: Excellent espresso drinks, period.  I have been there almost every day since they opened (live nearby) and its on par with some of my favorite spots like Coffee Bar, Four Barrel, and Blue Bottle.  The space itself is spare, but I happen to like that.  Staff is very friendly.
author: Kathryn A.

description: Love love love this new place.  The space is fantastic (and it's not even done yet, so will only improve!).  My cappuccino was fabulous, the snacks looked tasty (didn't order anything to eat bc had Alembic for dinner), and the simplicity of decor is perfect.  The only thing I'd improve is use of space, as many more tables could fit if space were optimized.  Either way, I will go back often for tasty coffee just a few blocks from home.
author: Sara S.

description: Flywheel just plain has fantastic coffee and cool people
author: Seva Simran K.

description: This place is great. My husband and I went in asking for the best cup of coffee, and the baristas were knowledgeable and made us fantastic pour-overs that we won't soon forget. We'll plan to visit this place anytime we are near golden gate park. Yum!
author: jennifer b.

description: This is a work in progress, but I really like where they're going. Far and away the best coffee shop in the neighborhood. I don't know the specifics, but I believe it is owned and run by the younger generation of the Martha Bros coffee shops in Noe. You can tell that it's family owned and run, which I love. They're currently installing the coffee roaster and I can't wait to smell fresh roasting coffee. They're adding a deck out back as well.
author: Nick L.

description: I'll start with the service, because really, that's all they have going for them.  The family running this joint is very friendly and welcoming.  This is the only reason they've gotten two stars from me.  When I first passed by, as I live one block away, I was so excited to see the wooden tables set into the walls.  Another Four Barrel? A Site Glass, perhaps?!  I was quickly deflated however, as the plastic white chairs were set up inside... and there they remained.  The coffee was T.E.R.R.I.B.L.E.  I ordered a cappuccino and they poured in air-foamed milk and then the espresso shot on top of the milk!!  I had a foamy milk (not the smooth, velvety milk delivered by experienced baristas, mind you) with a black hole in the middle where the gritty, burnt shot had been poured.  SO DISAPPOINTING. To compare Flywheel to Ritual Roasters or Site Glass is an embarrassment at best.  I was sincerely hoping for a hip, quality coffee house in the Haight, as I have been waiting forever.  I just don't know what happened.  I understand that they are adding a roaster; if they invest in professional training sessions for the baristas, there may be hope yet.
author: Android H.

description: great coffee, patio out back, nice people, free wifi. that makes a 5 star cafe for me
author: Joren D.
